III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth R alleged Staff 1 & Staff 2 attempted to fight her on 5/17/24.
Youth R has a scratch on her wrist.
Investigation Video:
According to Complainant, Youth R said the alleged incident
occurred in bedroom 4 on 5/17/24 between 10:09pm – 10:12pm.
There are no video cameras in the youths’ bedrooms, and nothing
was seen on the footage reviewed.
Interviews
I notified Complainant of this investigation assignment in person
on 5/22/24. She said Youth R showed her a 1” superficial scratch
on her wrist and told her Staff 1 and Staff 2 tried to fight her. If
this happened, Complainant said it would be out of character for
Staff 1 and Staff 2.
I notified Youth R’s Foster Care Worker of the investigation, and
she expressed no additional concerns.
I interviewed Youth R jointly with Government Worker on 5/22/24.
She claimed she did not know anything about the alleged incident.
“I’m not talking to CPS. This is triggering me. Fuck. Shit. No.”
Youth R walked out of the interview room before we could observe
the abrasion.
I interviewed Supervisor jointly with Government Worker on
5/22/24. She said she was on Youth R’s wing and left for a few
minutes. When she returned, Youth R showed her a scratch on
her left wrist and said she got it from Staff 1 and Staff 2 who had
fought her in room 4 while Supervisor was off the wing.
2

Supervisor did not witness Staff 1 or Staff 2 fighting Youth R. She
said Youth R had destroyed property, assaulted staff and was
physically managed in the preceding 90 minutes so could have
scratched herself or been accidentally scratched by another
person in the process. Supervisor said she completed a body
chart and administered first aid to the abrasion on Youth R’s wrist.
Later that evening on-call Government Worker 2 arrived and
directed Supervisor to have Youth R taken out for medical
treatment. Supervisor arranged for Youth R to be transported to
the emergency room for additional treatment for the abrasion.
I interviewed Youth J jointly with Government Worker on 5/22/24.
She said she told Youth R to “shut the fuck up or I’d kick her ass.”
In the hallway Youth J said she saw Youth R kicking the wall and
hitting Staff 1 and Staff 2 on various parts of their bodies. “They
(Staff 1 and Staff 2) let her hit them. I got mad so I started hitting
Youth R…Staff 1 and Staff 2 did not hit Youth R. I don’t know why
she says that. The police came and Youth R calmed down.”
I interviewed Youth A jointly with Government Worker on 5/22/24.
She denied witnessing anything on 5/17/24 related to Youth R,
Staff 1 and Staff 2.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker on 5/22/24.
She is a case manager but assumed the role as direct care staff
on 5/17/24. Ninety minutes prior to the alleged incident, Staff 1
said Youth R refused to step in her room for her safety as
directed. “She kicked, punched, picked holes in and was covered
in drywall. She kicked a male staff and fell on the ground. Youth
R pulled insulation out of the wall and threw it in our faces. She
flashed her private parts to Staff 2 and used profanity. Supervisor
and Staff 2 cleared out Youth R's room for her safety. Youth R
became loud, banging on doors and unscrewed a bathroom
mirror. I verbally de-escalated. Youth R stood on a table and
tried to use the phone without permission. She flicked lights on
and off and swung the phone at Staff 2. Her peers were getting
irritated. Youth J and Youth R exchanged words. I blocked them
to prevent a fight. They got hold of my hair.” Youth R went into
Youth J’s room and threatened to destroy it. “She threw water in
the room and kicked us. We (Staff 1 and Staff 2) attempted to
restrain her but were not able to…Police were called to transport
her to the hospital for a psychiatric evaluation.”
Staff 1 denied fighting Youth R and also denied that Staff 2 fought
her. She insisted, “We followed Vista Maria’s behavior
management model for de-escalation.”
3

I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker on 5/22/24.
She has worked at the facility for two years. Staff 2 said Youth R
displayed dangerous behaviors prior to the alleged incident. “She
scratched me and tried to bite me. We observed marks on Staff
2’s right forearm. We separated her from a peer. Youth R ran into
Youth J’s room and started tearing it up. Staff 1 and I tried to
block her from trashing the room. Youth R poured water from a
water bottle. We stepped in to get the water bottle and she
attacked us. We were unable to manage her. She sat down on
the floor and then exited Youth J’s room. Youth R showed me a
scratch on her wrist. At the end of the shift, I found out she
alleged that me and Staff 1 fought her in Youth J’s room.”
Staff 2 denied fighting Youth R and also denied that Staff 1 fought
her.
Documents reviewed:
Photo of Youth R’s left inner wrist taken by Government Worker 2
on 5/18/24 showing a ½” horizontal abrasion.
An incident report by Staff 1 dated 5/17/24 at 10:33pm indicates
“Youth R entered Youth J’s room… Staff 1 and Staff 2 entered in
attempts to stop Youth R from destroying Youth J’s things. Youth
R poured water all over Youth J’s floor, bed, and stuffed animals.
Youth R began to swing and hit Staff 1 and Staff 2 with a closed
fist. Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to place Youth R in a CPI hold.
Youth R began to kick Staff 2 and bite then dropped to the floor,
sitting in between the desk. Staff 1 and Staff 2 continued to offer
verbal support to Youth R, asking for her to come out of Youth J’s
room. Youth R exited the room…”
Emergency room discharge instructions indicate Youth R was
seen on 5/18/24 for pain in her right hand after she punched a
wall. She was not seen for the abrasion on her left wrist that she
alleged was caused by Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth R’s right hand
was x-rayed, a splint was applied, and she was given Tylenol and
Motrin. Follow up with an orthopedic surgeon was recommended.
On 6/6/24, this case was transferred from Government Worker to
Government Worker 2.
Government Worker 2 had no findings.
Analysis There is no evidence Staff 1 and/or Staff 2 physically fought Youth
R or attempted to fight her. Prior to the alleged incident Youth R
4

punched a wall and injured her right hand. The abrasion on her
left wrist was likely caused by Youth R physically acting out and
destroying property.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
